summary: A character reference letter written by Lyons to Judge Alison Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application. The writer describes a long friendship with Maxwell, vouches for her character, denies she poses a danger to children, and offers to provide financial surety for bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the character reference letter, seeking bail. The writer describes her as a close friend of many years, vouches for her integrity, and argues she is not a flight risk or danger to children.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: The Honourable Judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York to whom the character reference letter is addressed.

persons.name: Lyons
persons.role: Author of character reference, friend of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The author of the letter, who describes a close friendship with Ghislaine Maxwell since around 2002, vouches for her character, and offers to provide financial surety for her bail.

connections.description: Close friends since around 2002, socializing regularly, including attending her 50th birthday party. Lyons is a trustee of Maxwell's charity, Terramar.
Lyons offers to provide financial surety to meet any bail pledge the court sets for Maxwell.

events.title: First Meeting
events.description: Lyons first met Ghislaine Maxwell through a mutual friend at a dinner in Los Angeles.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The letter is a character reference for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, arguing she is not a flight risk or a danger to children.
The writer, Lyons, states they would have "absolutely no hesitation" in allowing Maxwell to look after their young daughter.
Lyons offers to provide a financial surety to meet any bail pledge set by the court.
The letter mentions Maxwell's charity, Terramar, and that Lyons served as a trustee.
The writer references "monstrous allegations in the press" that forced Maxwell to worry about her safety.
